description: God initiated and carried out the creation of the universe.
God created the primordial heavens.
God created the primordial earth.
The Spirit of God was present and active during creation.
The Spirit of God was hovering over the waters during the initial state of creation.
The deep was a feature of the primordial earth.
Darkness was over the face of the deep.
God created light and separated it from darkness on the first day.
The events of the first day of creation took place in the context of the primordial earth.
God created the expanse on the second day.
God made the expanse.
God called the expanse 'Heaven'.
The creation of the expanse occurred in the midst of the waters of the primordial earth.
The Heaven (Sky) is the expanse, a part of the overall heavens created.
God gathered the waters and revealed dry land on the third day.
God caused the dry land to appear.
God called the gathered waters 'Seas'.
The formation of dry land and seas occurred from the primordial earth.
The dry land appeared from the primordial earth.
The seas were gathered waters on the primordial earth.
God created the sun, moon, and stars on the fourth day.
God made the greater light, the sun.
God made the lesser light, the moon.
God made the stars.
The celestial bodies were set in the expanse of the heavens.
The sun was set in the expanse of the heavens.
The moon was set in the expanse of the heavens.
The stars were set in the expanse of the heavens.
God created sea creatures and birds on the fifth day.
God created the great sea creatures and every living creature that moves in the waters.
God created every winged bird.
Sea creatures were created to swarm in the waters of the seas.
Birds were created to fly across the expanse of the heavens.
God created land animals and humanity on the sixth day.
God made livestock.
God made creeping things.
God made the beasts of the earth.
God created humanity in His own image.
Land animals and humanity were created on the dry land.
The creation of the universe involved the creation of the heavens.
The creation of the universe involved the creation of the earth.
